column3: How can we test this to make sure it makes connectivity better instead of the same or worse?\n

I'm not sure how to test it well, but it makes sense. Preferring nodes that just happen to be in the same irc channel we are is always going to leave a large chunk of good connectable nodes out of the list of possible outbound connections and could eventually lead to island networks in some cases.\n

I've been running it on a node for a week after I observed that it was only had outbound connections to hosts in the same IRC channel.   It has two now.  \n\nIt doesn't completely fix the behavior. Because IRC updates the addr.nTime and the time since then is used to control the retry interval it makes nodes much more likely to connect within the channel they are in.
